sen.j: 長田 忠致（おさだ ただむね、生年不詳 - 建久元年（1190年））は平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: Tadamune OSADA (born on an unknown date, died in 1190) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) at the end of the Heian period.
Tadamune OSADA (date of birth unknown, died in 1190) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) at the end of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: ・訂正born on an unknown date→date of birth unknown

sen.j: 門真致俊の子で、長田景致の父。
sen.e: He was the child of Munetoshi KADOMA and the father of Kagemune OSADA.
sen.cmt: ＊「門真致俊」の読み方は推測です（正確な読みは確認できませんでした）。

sen.j: 出自は桓武平氏の末流で、『尊卑分脈』による記述では藤原道長四天王の一人とされた平致頼の5世孫にあたる。
sen.e: He was descended from the Kanmu-Heishi (a branch of the Taira clan), and according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy)", he was the goseimago (the son of great-great-grandchild) of TAIRA no Muneyori who was one of FUJIWARA no Michinaga Shitenno (the four most royal retainers of FUJIWARA no Michinaga).
sen.cmt: ＊「桓武平氏」：平氏の一派である（伊勢平氏を生み、清盛を輩出した派）とわかりましたため、カッコ内意訳の部分が、 Kanmu-Heishi (a branch of the Taira clan)との記載のほうが良いのかもしれないとも考え、そのように訳しました。平氏の様々な流派：参考：http://www.weblio.jp/content/%E5%B9%B3%E6%B0%8Fhttp://www6.plala.or.jp/HEIKE-RAISAN/keifu/keifu1.html＊「藤原道長四天王」は定訳不明にて、意味を推測の上、意訳いたしました。＊五世孫は、玄孫の子ですので、意味を訳しておりますが、ローマ字表記も省かずに記載いたしております。
sen.e: He was descended from the Kanmu-Heishi (a branch of the Taira clan), and according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy)", he was the goseimago (the son of great-great-grandchild) of TAIRA no Muneyori who was one of the FUJIWARA no Michinaga Shitenno (the big four retainers of FUJIWARA no Michinaga).
sen.cmt: ・訂正the four most royal retainers→the big four retainers「四天王」の訳について、trans1意訳もすばらしかったのですが、より平易なものに変更しました。

sen.j: 尾張国野間（愛知県知多郡美浜町 (愛知県)）を本拠地とし、平治年間には源氏に従っていたという。
sen.e: He was based in Noma, Owari Province, and was working for Genji (the Minamoto clan) during the Heiji era (1159-1160).
sen.cmt: *「平治年間」は、年号のみ、言葉のみのいずれで訳せばいいか不明でしたので、Heiji era (1159-1160）との形式で訳しました。http://www.emuseum.jp/detail/101114/000/000?mode=detail&d_lang=ja&s_lang=ja&class=6&title=&c_e=&region=&era=&century=&cptype=&owner=&pos=1&num=1http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=NnsEAAAAMAAJ&q=%22heiji+era%22++1159-1160&dq=%22heiji+era%22++1159-1160&hl=ja&ei=N-mQTNTCMcOeceS7sc0M&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CDwQ6AEwAw
sen.e: He was based in Noma, Owari Province, and was working for Genji (the Minamoto clan) during the Heiji era (1159-1160).

sen.j: 平治元年（1159年）、平治の乱に敗れた源義朝は、東国への逃避行の途中、随行していた鎌田政清の舅である忠致のもとに身を寄せる。
sen.e: In 1159, while MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo who was defeated in the Heiji War was escaping to Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region), he put himself under the protection of Tadamune, who was the father-in-law of Masakiyo Kamata, a person accompanying him at that time.

In 1159, MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo defeated in the Heiji War and was escaping to Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) put himself under the protection of Tadamune, who was the father-in-law of Masakiyo Kamata, a person accompanying him at that time.
sen.cmt: ・trans1が少し読みづらい気がしましたので、修正しました。
sen.e: In 1159, MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo defeated in the Heiji War and was escaping to Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) put himself under the protection of Tadamune, who was the father-in-law of Masakiyo Kamata, a person accompanying him at that time.

sen.j: しかし、忠致・景致父子は平家からの恩賞を目当てに義朝を浴場で騙し討ちにし、その首を六波羅の平清盛の元に差し出した。
sen.e: However, Tadamune and his son, Kagemune, trapped and killed Yoshitomo in a bathroom for a reward from Heike (the Taira family), and offered the head of Yoshitomo to TAIRA no Kiyomori in Rokuhara.
sen.cmt: ＊「六波羅」は用語集を参照しましたが、ここでは地名と思われ、地名の場合はRokuharaとする、という記載が用語集にございましたため、左記の訳としました。
sen.e: However, Tadamune and his son, Kagemune, trapped Yoshitomo and killed him in a bathroom for a reward from Heike (the Taira family), and offered the head of Yoshitomo to TAIRA no Kiyomori in Rokuhara.
sen.cmt: ・訂正trapped and killed Yoshitomo→trapped Yoshitomo and killed him
sen.e: However, Tadamune and his son, Kagemune, trapped Yoshitomo and killed him in a bathroom for a reward from Heike (the Taira family), and offered the head of Yoshitomo to TAIRA no Kiyomori in Rokuhara.

sen.j: この際、政清も同時に殺害されたため、嘆き悲しんだ忠致の娘（政清の妻）は川に身を投げて自殺したとされる。
sen.e: The daughter of Tadamune (the wife of Masakiyo) is said to have drowned herself in the river due to great sadness, because Masakiyo was also killed at the same time.
Masakiyo was also killed at the time, the daughter of Tadamune (the wife of Masakiyo) is said to have committed suicide by throwing herself into the river due to great sorrow.
sen.cmt: ・trans1が少し読みづらい気がしましたので、修正しました。
sen.e: Masakiyo was also killed at the time, the daughter of Tadamune (the wife of Masakiyo) is said to have committed suicide by throwing herself into the river due to great sorrow.

sen.j: 義朝を討った功により忠致は壱岐国守に任ぜられるが、この行賞に対してあからさまな不満を示し「左馬頭、そうでなくともせめて尾張国か美濃国の国司にはなって然るべきであるのに」などと申し立てたため、かえって清盛らの怒りを買い処罰されそうになり、慌てて引き下がったという。
sen.e: Tadamune, who was appointed as Iki no kuni no Kami (Governor of Iki Province) in return for the assassination of Yoshitomo, expressed open dissatisfaction with the reward and complained 'I deserve the position of Sama no kami (Captain of Samaryo, Left Division of Bureau of Horses) or at least Kokushi (provincial governor) of Mino Province or Owari Province,' but allegedly, he hastily withdrew the complaint later because he was about to be punished by Kiyomori who was offended by the remark.
sen.cmt: ＊「左馬頭」の対訳は、用語登録よりSamaryoの説明がなされているものを選びました。

sen.j: そのあさましい有様を『平治物語』は終始批判的に叙述している。
sen.e: His disgraceful behavior is described in "Heiji Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heiji) in a totally critical tone.

sen.j: 後に源頼朝が兵を挙げるとその列に加わる。
sen.e: Later, when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo raised his army, Tadamune joined his side.
Later, when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo raised his army, Tadamune joined his side.

sen.j: 忠致は頼朝の実父殺しという重罪を負う身であったが、頼朝から寛大にも「懸命に働いたならば美濃尾張をやる」と言われたため、その言葉通り懸命に働いたという。
sen.e: Yoritomo generously told Tadamune, who had committed the serious sin of killing Yoritomo's real father, 'If you work hard, I'll give you Mino-Owari (meaning Mino and Owari Provinces),' and therefore, Tadamune worked hard believing in his word.
sen.cmt: ＊「美濃尾張」は後に掛詞として本文に登場する関係上、読み方をローマ字表記して意味を括弧つきで訳す形といたしました。
sen.e: Yoritomo generously told Tadamune, who had committed the serious sin of killing Yoritomo's real father, 'If you work hard, I'll give you Mino-Owari (meaning Mino and Owari Provinces),' Tadamune worked hard believing in his word.
sen.cmt: ・冗長に感じましたので、 and therefore, を削除しました。
sen.e: Yoritomo generously told Tadamune, who had committed the serious sin of killing Yoritomo's real father, 'If you work hard, I'll give you Mino-Owari (meaning Mino and Owari Provinces),' Tadamune worked hard believing in his word.

sen.j: しかし平家追討後に頼朝が覇権を握ると、やはりその父の仇として追われる身となり、最後は頼朝の命によって殺害されたらしい。
sen.e: However, when Yoritomo came into power after Heike (the Taira family) was searched out and destroyed, Tadamune came to be pursued as an enemy who murdered Yoritomo's father after all, and he was allegedly killed on the orders of Yoritomo at last.
sen.cmt: *「平家追討」に関しまして、登録の対訳よりも用語統一リストの記載を優先しました。
sen.e: However, when Yoritomo came into power after Heike (the Taira family) was searched out and destroyed, Tadamune came to be accused as an enemy who murdered Yoritomo's father after all, and he was allegedly killed on the orders of Yoritomo at last.

However, when Yoritomo came into power after Heike (the Taira family) was searched out and destroyed, Tadamune came to be accused as an enemy who murdered Yoritomo's father after all, and he was allegedly killed on the orders of Yoritomo at last.

sen.j: その折には「約束通り、美濃尾張（身の終わり）をやる」と言われたとも伝えられている。
sen.e: According to a legend, Yoritomo told Tadamune 'As promised, I will give you Mino-Owari' when he was killed. (The word "Mino-Owari" has double meaning here. The word basically means "Mino and Owari Provinces", but it also means "the end of your life" with the same pronunciation when spelled differently in Japanese.)
sen.cmt: ＊「言われた」は、忠致が頼朝に言われた（頼朝が忠致に言った）ものとして翻訳いたしました。かぎ括弧内は頼朝の発言として訳しました。＊美濃尾張/身の終わりとの掛詞は括弧つきで二つの意味を説明いたしました。

sen.cmt: ・複文になっていましたので、一文にしました。

sen.j: 処刑の年代や場所、最期の様子については諸説があって判然としないが、『保暦間記』によると建久元年10月の頼朝の上洛の際に、美濃で斬首されたことになっている。
sen.e: The date and the place of the execution of Tadamune and his attitude at that time are unclear because there are several stories about them, but according to "Horyakukanki" (A History Book of the 14th century in Japan), Tadamune was beheaded in Mino Province in October 1190 when Yoritomo went to the capital (Kyoto).
sen.cmt: ＊『保暦間記』は用語集登録どおりの訳といたしましたが、14の後にthを補っております。

sen.j: その後、残された子孫は三河の南（現在の碧南市棚尾地区）に逃げ、後世には英知を生かして西洋医学に励んだという。
sen.e: It is said that his surviving descendents subsequently escaped to the south of Mikawa Province (present-day Tanao District, Hekinan City) and they worked hard on learning Western medicine by utilizing their intellect in later generations.

sen.j: また、戦国時代に活躍した徳川家康の家臣永井直勝は末裔で、長田の姓を嫌った家康の命により永井と改名したという。
sen.e: By the way, Naokatsu NAGAI who actively worked as a retainer of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in the Sengoku period (the period of warring states) was a descendent of Tadamune OSADA, and it is said that he changed his surname to NAGAI on the order of Ieyasu who hated his original surname, OSADA.

sen.j: また、甲斐国へ逃げたという説もあり、山梨県に今でも長田家はあるという。
sen.e: One legend suggests that the surviving descendents of Tadamune OSADA escaped to Kai Province (present-day Yamanashi Prefecture), and it is said that the Osada family still exists in Yamanashi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ＊後半の文意を理解しやすくするため、甲斐国に逃げた、との部分に括弧つきで（現在の山梨県）と付け加えました。＊逃げたのが誰かについてですが、前列の内容を受け、「長田の子孫」が逃げたものと解釈して訳しました。
